message_1: A band consisting of 6 members needs to choose 3 members to perform at a concert. How many different ways can this be done?
message_2:
To find the number of ways to choose 3 members from a band of 6 members, we can use the combination formula:

C(n, k) = n! / (k!(n-k)!)

where n is the total number of members (6 in this case) and k is the number of members to be chosen (3 in this case).

C(6, 3) = 6! / (3!(6-3)!)

C(6, 3) = 6! / (3!3!)

C(6, 3) = (6 × 5 × 4 × 3 × 2 × 1) / ((3 × 2 × 1)(3 × 2 × 1))

C(6, 3) = (720) / (6 × 6)

C(6, 3) = 720 / 36

C(6, 3) = 20

So there are 20 different ways to choose 3 members from a band of 6 members to perform at a concert.
